title: Soothe and Restore: Ayurvedic Baths for Sensitive Skin
author: Harish
excerpt: A warm oat-and-rose bath is one of Ayurveda’s simplest remedies for sensitive, irritated skin.
content:
The Ayurvedic Logic Behind Herbal Baths

Ayurveda suggests that warm, herbal-infused water calms aggravated doshas, especially Vata (dryness) and Pitta (heat). A bath is not just cleansing—it's medicinal when herbs are involved.

Why Oats, Rose & Calendula?

  • Oats: Natural emollient that softens dry skin.
  • Rose: Cooling, soothing, and Pitta-balancing.
  • Calendula: Traditionally used for minor skin irritation.

How to Prepare an Ayurvedic Bath

  1. Fill your tub with warm (not hot) water.
  2. Drop the filled muslin bath tea bag into the tub and let steep.
  3. Soak for 15–20 minutes in a calm, quiet environment.

How Often?

1–2 times a week is ideal for sensitive skin—frequent enough for nourishment but not over-drying.
